tool.name: Parallel Coordinates Plot

param.name: selected_mode
param.label: The mode of column selection for dimensions

param.name: col_dimensions
param.label: Type the column names
param.help: Two modes: 1) multiple names separated by comma, e.g. header1,header2, or 2) include * to initiate regular expression searches for every column name, for example, ^param_.* will retreive all the headers starting with param_. Note: no mix of the two is supported. Use default sanitizer: string.ascii_letters + string.digits + " -=_.()/+*^,:?!".

param.name: categorized_datatype
param.label: Cast all the dimensions into categorical datatype?

param.name: col_color
param.label: Select a column containg the values for coloring:

data.name: output
data.label: Plot visualization of tabular data on ${on_string}

tool.help:
**What it does**
Produce a `parallel coordinates plot <https://plot.ly/python/parallel-coordinates-plot/>`_ from a tabular file. Multiple columns are chosen for dimensions and a single column for coloring. The plot is buried in a html file which provides rich interactive features. Image can be saved in various format, such as 'png', 'svg', 'jpeg' and so on.
